articles.title: Kim Jong Il Congratulates Lao President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Congratulates Lao President

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Choummaly Sayasone, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, president of the Lao People's Democratic Republic and chairman of the Central Committee of Defence and Security of Laos, on the 36th founding anniversary of the Republic.
					
					 The message said:
					
					 I extend warm congratulations to you and, through you, to the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and the government and people of the Lao People's Democratic Republic on the 36th founding anniversary of the Republic.
					
					 After the foundation of the Republic the Lao people have steadily consolidated the people's democratic system chosen by themselves as the genuine masters of the country and, in this course, made the great socio-economic development.
					
					 The Korean people are pleased that the fraternal people of your country are defending the socialist idea and bolstering the state might as a whole under the leadership of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party headed by you and sincerely wish them better achievements in the efforts to attain the tasks and goals set forth in the 9th Congress of the party.
					
					 Expressing belief that the traditional DPRK-Laos friendly and cooperative relations would grow stronger in keeping with the noble intention of the preceding leaders of the two countries and the desire of the people, I wholeheartedly wish you greater success in your responsible work as well as you good health.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam to Visit Tanzania
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam to Visit Tanzania

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, will soon pay an official goodwill visit to the United Republic of Tanzania.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Lao Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Lao Ambassador

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with outgoing Lao Ambassador to the DPRK Chaleune Warinthrasak at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Lao President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Lao President

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greeting to Lao President Choummaly Sayasone on Thursday on the 36th anniversary of the founding of the Lao People's Democratic Republic. 
					
					 Kim Yong Nam in his message said the Lao people have achieved great successes in national defence and economic construction while firmly defending gains of the revolution under the correct leadership of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party for the past 36 years. 
					
					 The Korean people are pleased with it and sincerely hope that the friendly Lao people would achieve prosperity and development of the country by fully implementing the decision of the 9th Congress of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, he said. 
					
					 He expressed belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries forged by President Kim Il Sung and respected leader of the Lao people Kaysone Phomvihane would continue to develop in the way for socialism against imperialism. He wished the Lao president good health and greater success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets Lao PM
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets Lao PM

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim sent a message of greeting to Prime Minister of Laos Thongsing Thammavong on Thursday on the 36th anniversary of the founding of the Lao People's Democratic Republic. 
					
					 Choe said in his message that he is pleased with the fact that the Lao government and people have made many successes in their efforts to defend gains of the revolution, develop the people's democratic system and strengthen the overall national capability under the leadership of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party. 
					
					 Expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries forged in the way for accomplishing the common cause of independence and socialism against imperialism would grow stronger, he wished the Lao prime minister and the Lao government success in the work to implement the 7th Five-year plan. 
					
					 DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun also sent a similar message to his Lao counterpart Thongloun Sisoulith who doubles as vice prime minister on the same day.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Central African President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Central African President

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Francois Bozize Yangoubonda, president of Central Africa, on the 53rd anniversary of the proclamation of its Republic.
					
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Central Africa would further develop, Kim in the message wished the president greater success in the work for the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Romanian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Romanian President

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Traian Basescu, president of Romania, on its national day.
					
					 Kim in the message expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would further develop in the common interests and desire of the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets Romanian PM
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets Romanian PM

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim sent a message of greeting to Prime Minister of Romania Emil Boc on Thursday on the national day of Romania.
					
					 Wishing the friendly people of Romania progress and prosperity, the message expressed expectation that the bilateral ties would continue to grow stronger.
					
					 DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to his Romanian counterpart Theodore Baconschi on the same day.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets UAE President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets UAE President

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Sheikh Halifa Bin Zayed Al－Nahayan, president of the United Arab Emirates, on its national day.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam in his message wished the president of UAE happiness in good health and bigger success in his work and its friendly people steady progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets UAE Vice President
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets UAE Vice President

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim Thursday sent a message of greeting to Sheikh Muhammad Bin Rashid Al－Maktoum, vice president and premier of the United Arab Emirates, on its national holiday.
					
					 Choe in the message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would be further consolidated and developed thanks to the joint effort and wished him greater success in the work for the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: DPRK FM Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK FM Delegation Back Home

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Foreign Ministry delegation headed by Vice-Minister Kim Song Gi came back home by air Thursday after winding up its visit to China.

articles.title: Korea Experiences Abnormal Weather in November
articles.content:
Korea Experiences Abnormal Weather in November

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Korea had frequent rainfalls and comparatively high temperature in November.
					
					 Ri Chol Su, deputy director of the Central Meteorological Research Institute under the Hydro-Meteorological Service, told KCNA:
					
					 Usually, not much rain falls in Korea in autumn.
					
					But, the country's average precipitation in November was 57.7 mm, much higher than that of the normal year, 33.7 mm.
					
					 Pyongyang and Phyongsong cities witnessed the highest precipitation, 116.6 mm and 160.6 mm respectively.
					
					 Over 100 mm rainfalls were measured in most areas of North Phyongan Province and some areas of South Phyongan and Hwanghae provinces.
					
					 On average, twelve days were rainy in November throughout the country, five days more that the average year, while 15 to 17 days were rainy in Pyongyang, Hamhung and Wonsan, 
					
					 The average temperature was 5 degrees centigrade, 2.9 degrees centigrade higher than the normal.
					
					 It was 8.4 degrees centigrade in Pyongyang, 9.4 in Kaesong and 10.4 in Haeju.
					
					 The first snowy day is November 17 on an average in the country. But there has been no snow yet this year.
					
					 The temperature will remain little high till December 7 than the average year and it will be cold for a week from December 8 throughout the country.

articles.title: Day of Cuban Armed Forces Marked in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Day of Cuban Armed Forces Marked in Pyongyang

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Ambassador German Hermin Ferras Alvarez and Military Attache Leonardo Perez Mesa of the Cuban embassy here Thursday hosted a reception on the 55th anniversary of the revolutionary armed forces of Cuba.
					
					 Present there on invitation were generals and officers of the Korean People's Army, officials concerned, diplomatic envoys and military attaches of foreign embassies here.
					
					 Staff members of the Cuban embassy were on hand. 
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Observed

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- An academic symposium and experience-sharing meeting of officials in the field of revolutionary relic preservation took place here Thursday. It marks the 20th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's historic letter "Let Us Successfully Carry Forward and Develop the Revolutionary Traditions of Juche." 
					
					 The work, published on Dec. 5, Juche 80 (1991), clarifies the essence of the work of revolutionary relic preservation, its main principle, tasks, etc. 
					
					 Present there were Kim Jong Im, director of the Party History Institute of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned, officials in the field of revolutionary relic preservation and teachers of universities.
					
					 The speakers said that to successfully carry forward and develop the revolutionary traditions as required by the Songun era provides a sure guarantee for accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche, adding that to protect valuable treasure of the Korean revolution is the  first mission and sacred duty of the officials in the field of revolutionary relic preservation.
					
					 They referred to the achievements and experience gained in the work of revolutionary relic preservation in the past, calling for devoting wisdom and enthusiasm to glorifying the immortal exploits of great persons of Mt. Paektu.

articles.title: Int'l Day of Disabled Persons Marked
articles.content:
Int'l Day of Disabled Persons Marked

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- A meeting of the disabled took place at the Taedonggang Cultural Center of Disabled Persons on Thursday on the International Day of Disabled Persons. 
					
					 Present at the meeting were Minister of Public Health Choe Chang Sik who is chairman of the Central Committee of the Federation for the Care of the Disabled of Korea, officials concerned and disabled persons. Members of EU aid mission and foreign embassy officials here were on hand. 
					
					 Speakers at the meeting stressed the need to develop the work with the disabled by boosting cooperation among countries and international organizations. 
					
					 An art performance was given. 
					
					 Meanwhile, a table-tennis tournament took place at the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium on the occasion of the day.

articles.title: World AIDS Day Marked
articles.content:
World AIDS Day Marked

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- An event to observe World AIDS Day was held at the People's Palace of Culture in DPRK on Thursday. 
					
					 Present there were DPRK officials of the ministries, national institutions, social organizations and public health organs and representatives and members of the international missions to the DPRK including WHO.
					
					The speakers mentioned the importance of the prevention of AIDS as it poses serious threat to the world.
					
					 They underlined the need to prevent and control AIDS in close cooperation with the international organizations.
					
					 The participants appreciated a video-tape dealing with the contents based on the theme set by the WHO for this year. 
					
					 Then they looked around photos and posters on prevention of AIDS.

articles.title: Many Modern Fish Farms Built
articles.content:
Many Modern Fish Farms Built

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Many fish farms have been built on a modern basis in the DPRK.
					
					 Fish farms have appeared in Rinsan and Singye counties, North Hwanghae Province, and Myonggan and Kilju counties, North Hamgyong Province, expanding the country's acreage of fish farming.
					
					 Ponds of the Sinchang Fish Farm are teeming with sturgeons. The farm succeeded in accustoming sturgeon to seawater.
					
					 The newly built research center of fish farming has an integrated system of research, breeding and processing of rare fish like salmon.
					
					 Fish breeding in streams has also proved successful for the first time in the country. 
					
					 Meanwhile, researches have been intensified to introduce and breed new species of fish, develop nutritious feed and additives and raise fish in a scientific and intensive way.
					
					 The Kujang Fish Farm and Poman Fish Farm are well known in the country for making incubation of rainbow trout and carp in a scientific way and increasing the survival rate of their fries.

articles.title: Mt. Chilbo Attracts Many Tourists
articles.content:
Mt. Chilbo Attracts Many Tourists

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Mt. Chilbo in the northeastern part of Korea has drawn 550 Chinese tourists from October 8. 
					
					 They went to the famous mountain by train, belonging to five groups. 
					
					 An official of the State General Bureau of Tourism, Jong Il Hyon, told KCNA:
					
					 The Chinese tourists admired fantastic rocks, beautiful pavilions and other beauty spots of the mountain.
					
					 They were greatly interested in legends and historical stories about the mountain.
					
					 They enjoyed themselves in Sea Chilbo, taking a variety of seafood.
					
					 During the tourism they stayed in dwelling houses together with their owners. The houses are of one or two stories and of Korean and European styles. Their accommodation capacity is 40-100 people. 
					
					 After touring the mountain, they had a hot-spring bath in Kyongsong County and visited Chongjin City.
					
					 The Mt. Chilbo tourism provided the tourists with a good understanding of the Korean people's history, culture, traditions and customs.
					
					 They requested officials of the Korean travel agency to organize such tourism in all seasons and extend its period.
					
					 The tourism took place in the form of one night and two days, two nights and three days, and three nights and four days.

articles.title: Chosan Revolutionary Site
articles.content:
Chosan Revolutionary Site

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- The Chosan Revolutionary Site is situated in Chosan County, Jagang Province, the DPRK. 
					
					 The revolutionary site is associated with the feats Kim Hyong Jik, an indomitable revolutionary fighter, performed in the anti-Japanese national liberation struggle.
					
					 He visited there several times, including in November Juche 7 (1918), to restore organizations of the Korean National Association (KNA) which were destroyed or daunted by the Japanese imperialists' suppression. He also worked hard there to develop the anti-Japanese national liberation struggle.  
					
					 He met KNA members and other anti-Japanese and pro-independence activists from throughout the country to indicate ways of invigorating the anti-Japanese struggle based on armed struggle.  
					
					 He also explained to Chosan-based KNA members about the policy adopted at the Chongsudong meeting and encouraged pro-independence organizations in the areas along the River Amnok to turn out in the patriotic struggle against the Japanese imperialists. 
					
					 Preserved in the site are historic relics, including Paesin School.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges Abrogation of NSL
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges Abrogation of NSL

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- There is no reason for the south Korean authorities to refuse to repeal the "National Security Law" which is contrary to the trend of the times and has become an object of criticism by the public at home and abroad.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 The NSL is the fascist law ruthlessly violating political freedom and democratic rights of the people, and it is the wicked anti-reunification law inciting inter-Korean confrontation and obstructing national reconciliation and unity, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is the evil law without precedent in the world history of laws as it infringes upon people's freedom of thought and rights to socio-political activities.
					
					 The south Korean conservative group revived the NSL, which was once emasculated, and has invoked it to ruthlessly trample down the elementary achievements for democracy gained by the people at the cost of their blood. This is an unpardonable crime against human rights.
					
					 The NSL defines the DPRK as "anti-state organization", thus providing legal grounds to suppress progressive parties and organizations, patriotic personages and people of different strata desirous of national reconciliation and unity and reunification through alliance with the north as "north-benefiting organizations" and "forces for overturning system".
					
					 It incriminates any contact and exchange between the north and the south.
					
					 It is an anachronistic deed for the south Korean conservative authorities to keep the NSL in force.
					
					 Now is the June 15 era of reunification in which the Koreans are achieving independent reunification, peace and prosperity by their concerted efforts.
					
					 The NSL contrary to this trend has been strongly rejected by the Koreans for its anti-reunification and fascist nature. The international community is also demanding the repeal of the NSL, terming it the evil law mercilessly violating human rights.
					
					 There is no ground for the NSL to exist any longer as it antagonizes the fellow countrymen and incriminates the struggle for national unity and reunification.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Reveals Danger of Triangular Military Alliance
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Reveals Danger of Triangular Military Alliance

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- The danger of the U.S.-Japan-south Korea triangular military alliance was disclosed by a bylined article of Rodong Sinmun Thursday.
					
					 The article said that the joint military exercises between the U.S. and Japan and between the U.S. and south Korea were staged on the Korean Peninsula and in its surrounding waters from late October to early November.
					
					 This shows that the alliance exists and runs in actuality even though it was not formally declared in Northeast Asia, the article said, citing facts.
					
					 It continued:
					
					 Recently Japan and south Korea went on the rampage, straining the situation on the Korean Peninsula. The visits between those concerned of the Japan "Self-Defense Forces" and the south Korean puppet forces increased in number and a joint military exercise between Japan and south Korea was planned lately.
					
					 The planned joint military exercises would put the finishing touches on the military alliance, indicative of the scheme of the U.S., Japan and south Korea being put into practice to round off the triangular military alliance.
					
					 The U.S. is trying to use Japan and south Korea as cannon fodder and shock brigades in case of emergency on the Korean Peninsula through the tightened military conspiracy.
					
					 The military strategic commanding system of the U.S., Japanese and south Korean forces has been coordinated and joint operational plan was worked out.
					
					 It is the U.S. intention to establish its hegemony with ease in the Asia-Pacific region to save its position from sinking by using its henchmen.
					
					 The U.S.-led triangular military alliance is targeted against the DPRK. Herein lie its danger and severity. The military conspiracy will lead to the touch-and-go situation on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Songun Politics of DPRK Praised by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Songun Politics of DPRK Praised by Foreign Media

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Media of Bangladesh and Russia carried special write-ups on November 24 and 25 to mark the 20th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 The Bangladeshi newspaper Blits carried an article titled "The Songun Politics, Original Political Mode" with a photo of the leader acknowledging the cheering masses.
					
					 Kim Jong Il established the Songun politics as a main political mode under socialism for the first time in history by carrying forward President Kim Il Sung's idea and line of attaching importance to the army and military affairs, the paper said, adding:
					
					 He accomplished the historic cause of establishing the Korean-style political mode suited to the special condition under which the DPRK is building socialism in confrontation with the imperialists.
					
					 The Songun politics is a political mode that helps defend the country, revolution and socialism and accelerate socialist construction with the People's Army as a core and driving force.
					
					 This politics is the eternal political mode of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 A Russian magazine carried an article titled "Powerful Military Capability of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea".
					
					 It was of historic significance in defending and glorifying socialism that the Korean people acclaimed Kim Jong Il as the KPA supreme commander twenty years ago, the article noted, saying:
					
					 Kim Jong Il has strengthened in an overall way the political and ideological might of the People's Army under the banner of Songun.
					
					 Thanks to the Songun politics the DPRK had access to reliable nuclear deterrent and turned into an impregnable fortress.

articles.title: China Concentrates on Famine Relief
articles.content:
China Concentrates on Famine Relief

					 Beijing, November 30 (KCNA) -- Hu Jintao, president of China, mentioned the importance of the relief of poverty in a speech in the central meeting for the development of famine aid in Beijing on Nov. 29. 
					
					 It is of a great significance in defending the basic interests of the popular masses, consolidating the ruling groundwork of the party and ensuring the durable stability of the country to conduct the famine relief in an organized manner, he said.
					
					 He set it as a general goal to have the food and clothing problem of the poor settled and provide them with compulsory education, fundamental medical service and houses until 2020. He stressed the need for the party committees at all levels and the government to grapple this work and carry it out.

articles.title: China Calls for Improving Poor Children's Nutrition
articles.content:
China Calls for Improving Poor Children's Nutrition

					 Beijing, November 30 (KCNA) -- Chinese State Councilor Liu Yandong called for improving the nutritive conditions of schoolchildren in rural communities.
					
					 Speaking at a recent video-telephone conference, Liu said all regions, sectors and secondary and primary schools should attach importance to improving the nutritive conditions of children, particularly those of poor regions and families so that they can grow healthily.

articles.title: China Criticizes NATO's Attack on Pakistan's Military Post
articles.content:
China Criticizes NATO's Attack on Pakistan's Military Post

					 Beijing, November 30 (KCNA) -- A spokesperson of the Chinese Foreign Ministry expressed the country's great surprise and deep concern over the fact that NATO's fighters attacked Pakistan's military post.
					
					 Speaking at a press conference on Monday, Hong Lei clarified the country's view that Pakistan's independence, sovereignty and territorial integrity should be respected substantially and that a thoroughgoing investigation should be made over the incident.

articles.title: Chinese Party Officials Urged to Faithfully Work for People
articles.content:
Chinese Party Officials Urged to Faithfully Work for People

					 Beijing, November 30 (KCNA) -- Li Yuanchao, head of the Organization Department of the C.C., the Communist Party of China, called on newly-appointed county party secretaries to faithfully work for the party, country and people.     
					
					 Addressing a recent round-table talk with members of a training course of county party secretaries, he said they should have a correct view of the party's policies and interests.
					
					 They should pay priority to improving the people's life, he added.

articles.title: Chinese Women Urged to Enhance Their Role
articles.content:
Chinese Women Urged to Enhance Their Role

					 Beijing, November 30 (KCNA) -- An annual meeting of the Chinese Society for Research of Women and a symposium on the development of the Chinese women in the new era and sex equality were held in Beijing recently.
					
					 Addressing the meeting, Chen Zhili, chairwoman of the society, said implementing the spirit of the Sixth Plenum of the 17th C.C., the Communist Party of China should be closely combined with the theoretical research for the women to encourage them to fully discharge their role in the establishment of the socialist hardcore value.
					
					 She also called for categorically opposing such practices as disrespecting and insulting women and infringing on their legal rights and interests.

articles.title: Chinese Official Calls for Developing Socialist Culture
articles.content:
Chinese Official Calls for Developing Socialist Culture

					 Beijing, November 30 (KCNA) -- A member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China (CPC), called for promoting the development of socialist culture with Chinese characteristics.  
					
					 Speaking at a meeting held in Beijing recently, Li Changchun said that men of literature and arts should create culture in the great socialist practice, clearly mindful of their mission granted by the times and the people.   
					
					 By promoting a signal development and prosperity of socialist culture, they should contribute to achieving the Chinese nation's great prosperity, he added.

articles.title: Russian President Calls for Modernizing Defense Industrial Complexes
articles.content:
Russian President Calls for Modernizing Defense Industrial Complexes

					 Moscow, November 30 (KCNA) -- Dmitri Medvedev, Russian president, recently called for modernizing the national defense industrial complexes.
					
					 Only when we refit the factories related to national defence industrial complexes is it possible to build new armed forces by 2020 and fulfill the task of supplying modern military technical equipment of high efficiency to the army, he said.
					
					 We have to start the work for this as soon as possible, he urged.

articles.title: Russia to Strongly Counter NATO's Moves for MD
articles.content:
Russia to Strongly Counter NATO's Moves for MD

					 Moscow, November 30 (KCNA) -- The commander of Air and Space Defense Forces of Russia in a recent press conference declared the stand of Russia to strongly counter the NATO's moves to deploy missile defense system (MD). 
					
					 If NATO does not opt for dialogue but continues to deploy MD, Russia is ready to operate new radar stations, he said, adding that these stations will surpass that in Kaliningrad in terms of capability. 
					
					 He stated that Russia is developing not only elements for information service including radar-locator but also other elements of MD of Russia.
					
					 If any action is taken against Russia, necessary counteractions will follow, he warned.

articles.title: Suppression of Demonstrators Intensified in US
articles.content:
Suppression of Demonstrators Intensified in US

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- The U.S. administration is spending huge amount of funds to intensify the repression of anti-Wall Street demonstrators. 
					
					 The Washington Post recently announced that about 13 million U.S. dollars were expended on the suppression of demonstrators. 
					
					 2.4 million dollars were reportedly spent in California State alone.

articles.title: Damage by Radioactive Contamination Increases in Japan
articles.content:
Damage by Radioactive Contamination Increases in Japan

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Damage by radioactive contamination following the accident at the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant is increasing in Japan.
					
					 During monitoring at around 30 spots in Kashiwa City, Chiba Prefecture, up to 450,000 becquerels of radioactive cesium per kilogram of soil was detected in the soil between 5 to 10 centimeters below the surface near the ditch, the minister of Environment said on Nov. 28.
					
					 1,050 becquerels of radioactive cesium at the maximum was detected in rice harvested at three farms in Fukushima Prefecture, the prefectural authorities said on the same day.

articles.title: OIC Urges NATO to Avoid Attacks on Pakistan
articles.content:
OIC Urges NATO to Avoid Attacks on Pakistan

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- The Organization of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) on Monday strongly condemned the recent NATO attacks against two Pakistani border posts which reportedly killed 24 Pakistani military personnel and left many others injured.
					
					 In a statement released by the organization on its website, the OIC Secretary General Ekmeleddin Ihsanoglu said that the attacks are indeed serious violation of Pakistan's sovereignty and are totally unacceptable.
					
					 The secretary general also urged NATO to avoid any action that could further complicate the security situation in the region.

articles.title: Re-assessment of Relations with US: Pakistani PM
articles.content:
Re-assessment of Relations with US: Pakistani PM

					Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Pakistani Prime Minister Syed Yusuf Raza Gilani in an interview on Monday said that Pakistan would reassess its relationship with the United States.
					
					He said at the moment Pakistan was not getting respect from the United States.
					
					He said in accordance with the wishes of the masses, Pakistan's relations with the United States should be based on trust, equality and mutual benefit.
					
					"We have no other option except to accept the will of the people." he said.

articles.title: Anti-NATO Rally in Pakistan
articles.content:
Anti-NATO Rally in Pakistan

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Lawyers in Pakistan's largest city of Karachi launched a strike on Monday to protest against the recent NATO attacks on a post of the Pakistani army, which killed 24 Pakistani troops and wounded 13 others.

articles.title: Iran to Target NATO Missile Shield If Attacked: IRGC Commander
articles.content:
Iran to Target NATO Missile Shield If Attacked: IRGC Commander

					 Tehran, November 30 (KCNA) -- The Commander of Aerospace Force of Iran's Islamic Revolution Guards Corps (IRGC) Amir Ali Hajizadeh said on Nov. 26 Iran will target NATO missile shield in Turkey if it was attacked by enemies.
					
					 "We constantly monitor the movements of the enemies of the (Islamic) revolution and Iran, and have no concern about the military movements by the enemies, and day by day we get more prepared for resistance," said Hajizadeh.

articles.title: Iran Increases Defense Capability
articles.content:
Iran Increases Defense Capability

					 Tehran, November 30 (KCNA) -- Iran is taking steps one after another to increase its defense capability.
					
					 The minister of Defense and Armed Forces Logistics of Iran said on Nov. 29 that a large number of home-made anti-aircraft guns were delivered to the Islamic Revolution Guards Corps of Iran.
					
					 This artillery is reportedly able to detect and intercept flying objects with the help of radar and optical system and destroy targets at sea as well.
					
					  Earlier on Nov. 27 three Ghadir-class submarines, each of 120 tons, were deployed in Iran's Navy.

articles.title: Indonesia to Launch Two New Industrial Zones
articles.content:
Indonesia to Launch Two New Industrial Zones

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- An Indonesian minister said on Monday that the country is preparing two industrial zones.
					
					 Sei Mangkei in North Sumatra province was designated to serve plants using palm oil and rubber as their raw materials. Tanjung Lesung in Pandeglang, Banten province will be built as a tourism center, said Trade Minister Gita Wirjawan.

articles.title: Unemployment in France Grows by 1.2 Pct in October
articles.content:
Unemployment in France Grows by 1.2 Pct in October

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- The number of jobless people in France grew by 1.2 percent in October from a month earlier.
					
					 According to labor ministry figures on Monday, France registered 34,400 more jobless people last month, which pulled up the country's total number of jobseekers to more than 2.814 million in France's mainland.

articles.title: Brazil's Rousseff Calls for Developing Science and Technology
articles.content:
Brazil's Rousseff Calls for Developing Science and Technology

					Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Brazilian President Dilma Rousseff in a recent speech referred to the development of science and technology.
					
					She called for development of science and technology and more investments in innovation.
					
					Innovation, science and technology will be leaps for Brazil, she said.
					
					The president also called for increasing local production of items which are currently being imported to create jobs.
					
					"We want to be a country without poverty, a middle class country with quality services." she said.

articles.title: Vietnam Calls for Displaying Patriotic Spirit
articles.content:
Vietnam Calls for Displaying Patriotic Spirit

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the National Assembly of Vietnam, addressing the second meeting of the 13th National Assembly on Nov. 29, called for giving full play to the patriotic spirit.
					
					 At the meeting the NA decided to channel efforts into keeping the rational speed of economic growth of the country and improving the standard of people's living, the chairman said.
					
					 In order to successfully carry out the tasks of the NA all the people, soldiers and overseas compatriots should give full play to the patriotic spirit and strengthen mutual cooperation, the chairman noted.

articles.title: Jordanian King Calls for Stop to Israeli Unilateral Act
articles.content:
Jordanian King Calls for Stop to Israeli Unilateral Act

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- King Abdullah II of Jordan on Monday called on the Israeli president to end the unilateral act of wrecking the regional peace.
					
					 He said the foundation of an independent Palestinian state with East Kuds as its capital is the key to resolving the Palestinian-Israeli conflict.
					
					 The Jordanian leader underlined the need for halting all unilateral Israeli measures, especially settlement activities that represent a main obstacle against peacemaking efforts. 
					
					 The Jordanian leader underlined the need for not taking any measures that alter the features of Jerusalem and harm the Islamic and Christian sites in the holy city.

articles.title: National Assembly Session Held in Vietnam
articles.content:
National Assembly Session Held in Vietnam

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- The Second Session of the 13th National Assembly of Vietnam was held from Nov. 26 to 29.
					
					 The session was attended by Nguyen Phu Trong, general secretary of the C.C., the Communist Party, and other senior party and state officials.
					
					 Adopted at the session were decisions concerning law of secrecy and legislation work of the next year.
					
					 The session also reviewed the 2006-2010 socio-economic work and adopted the 2012 state budget bill.

articles.title: Bolivia Renders Economic Assistance to Old People
articles.content:
olivia Renders Economic Assistance to Old People

					 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- The Bolivian government has set up a fund for rendering economic assistance to the people above 60.
					
					 The government allotted a large amount of money for the fund.
					
					 In the country those who benefit from the security system introduced by the government have reached 880,000. The figure is 200,000 more than 2008.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia mensaje a Choummaly Sayasone
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia mensaje a Choummaly Sayasone

					Pyongyang, 1 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia primero un mensaje a Choummaly Sayasone, Secretario General del Comite Central del Partido Popular Revolucionario Lao, Presidente de la Republica Democratica Popular Lao y del Comite Central de Defensa y Seguridad de la RDPL, para felicitarle por el 36o aniversario de la fundacion de la RDPL. 
					
					La misiva va como sigue: 
					
					En ocasion del 36o aniversario de la fundacion de la Republica Democratica Popular Lao, le hago llegar mis calurosas felicitaciones a Vd. y por su conducto, al Partido Popular Revolucionario Lao y al gobierno y el pueblo de la Republica Democratica Popular Lao. 
					
					Despues de la fundacion de la Republica, el pueblo lao, siendo verdadero dueno del pais, vino consolidando y desarrollando constantemente el regimen democratico popular optado por si mismo y ha logrado en ese curso un gran desarrollo socioeconomico. 
					
					Nuestro pueblo se regocija de que bajo la direccion del PPRL encabezado por Vd., el pueblo fraternal de vuestro pais defiende el ideal socialista y fortalece el poderio estatal en su conjunto, y le desea de todo corazon exitos mas excelentes en la lucha por alcanzar las tareas y metas presentadas en el 9o Congreso del Partido. 
					
					Convencido de que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion Corea-Laos se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran mas conforme al noble proposito de los lideres de veterana generacion y a la aspiracion de los pueblos de los dos paises, le deseo de todo corazon a Vd. mayores exitos en su trabajo responsable y buena salud.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam visitara la Republica Unida de Tanzania
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam visitara la Republica Unida de Tanzania

					Pyongyang, 1 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, realizara pronto una visita oficial y de amistad a la Republica Unida de Tanzania.

articles.title: Embajador y agregado militar de Cuba ofrecen banquete
articles.content:
Embajador y agregado militar de Cuba ofrecen banquete

					Pyongyang, 1 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 55o aniversario del dia de las Fuerzas Armadas Revolucionarias de Cuba el embajador German Hermin Ferras Alvarez y el agregado militar Leonardo Perez Mesa, de la Republica de Cuba en Corea ofrecieron el dia primero un banquete.
					
					　En la ocasion fueron invitados los generales y oficiales del Ejercito Popular de Corea y funcionarios interesados, asi como delegados diplomaticos y agregados militares de varios paises en Corea.
					
					　Participaron tambien los miembros de la sede diplomatica cubana.
					
					　En el banquete hubo discursos.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun revela peligrosidad de alianza militar tripartita
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun revela peligrosidad de alianza militar tripartita

					Pyongyang, 1 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El diario Rodong Sinmun difundio en su edicion de este jueves un articulo individual revelando la peligrosidad de la alianza militar tripartita entre EE.UU., Japon y el Sur de Corea.
					
					Desde finales de octubre hasta principios de noviembre, se libraron en la zona maritima en torno a la Peninsula Coreana los ejercicios conjuntos militares entre EE.UU. y Japon y entre EE.UU. y el Sur de Corea, comienza el articulo y continua:
					
					Esto muestra que la alianza militar tripartita existe realmente y esta en funcionamiento activo aunque no se ha proclamado en el Nordeste Asiatico.
					
					En estos momentos Japon y el Sur de Corea agravan mas la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana. Se hacen frecuentes las visitas entre los interesados de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" de Japon y los del ejercito titere surcoreano y se planean los ejercicios militares conjuntos entre ellos.
					
					Estos ejercicios belicos significan el ultimo manejo para la formacion de la alianza militar tripartita y muestran que se intensifican las maniobras encaminadas a ponerla en practica.
					
					EE.UU. intenta fortalecer la confabulacion militar con el Sur de Corea y Japon con el fin de utilizarlos como carnes de canon y brigadas de choque en el "tiempo de emergencia" de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Ya se ha unificado el sistema de operaciones y mando militares de las fuerzas armadas de EE.UU., Japon y el Sur de Corea y se ha establecido el plan de operaciones conjuntas. 
					
					De esta manera, el imperio pretende tomar sin dificultad la hegemonia en la region de Asia-Pacifico donde se disminuye su influencia.
					
					La alianza militar tripartita encabezada por EE.UU. toma a la RPDC como su blanco principal. He aqui la peligrosidad y gravedad de esta alianza militar. 
					
					Debido a la confabulacion militar de EE.UU., Japon y el Sur de Corea, la Peninsula Coreana se encuentra en la crisis que pueda convertirse en la guerra en cualquier momento.
